titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, American Literary Manuscripts (ALM) collection
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, American Literary Manuscripts (ALM) collection FA718

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-04 03:15:29 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, American Literary Manuscripts (ALM) collection

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Ford Foundation Archives participated in a survey begun in 1969, conducted by the Committee on Materials of American Literary History of the Modern Language Association (MLA). The result of this survey was the publication in 1977 of American Literary Manuscripts: A Checklist of Holdings in Academic Historical, and Public Libraries, Museums and Author's Homes in the United States (2nd edition, University of Georgia Press, 1977), edited by J. Albert Robbins. The first edition of American Literary Manuscriptswas published by University of Texas Press in 1960. The Ford Foundation participated in the ALM checklist as a manuscript-holding member, but was not a grantor of the ALM project.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at https://rockarch.org/collections/access-and-request-materials/#citations

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Some folders contain cross-references referring to the file of another individual in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p:
The American Literary Manuscripts collection is an artificial collection assembled by the Ford Foundation Archive's staff in the mid 1970s, in response to efforts to compile the second edition of the ALM checklist. The ALM collection includes correspondence; biographical, autobiographical, and financial information; speeches; research reports and other manuscript and typescript items.
Documents in the ALM collection were culled from the Ford Foundation's (1) Grant files, (2) Project files, (3) Log files, and (4) General Correspondence files. The remaining grant, project, log, and general correspondence file material, from which the ALM manuscripts were removed, is stored on microfilm in the Ford Foundation Archive.

The bulk of the Ford Foundation Archives' holdings cited in the ALM checklist (2nd edition, 1977) was extracted from grant and project files documenting the Humanities and Arts Division's fellowship programs for creative writers. These programs included:
Grant file 05900121 (PA59-121), PROGRAM FOR CREATIVE WRITERS;
Grant file 06000132 (PA60-132), PROGRAM FOR POETS AND FICTION WRITERS;
Grant file 06300513 (PA63-513), PROGRAM FOR POETS AND FICTION WRITERS;
Project File C-638: Program for the creative writer;
Project File C-918: Grants in Aid program for novelists and poets

The following authors appear in the published ALM checklist (2nd edition, 1977) as holdings in the Ford Foundation archive. However, the holdings have either been lost, or loaned out and not returned: Leonie Adams, Conrad Aiken, Robert Anderson, Louis Anchincloss, Marcus Bach, Joseph Freeman, Robert Frost, Caroline Gordon, and Allen Tate.

The following authors appear in the published ALM checklist (2nd edition, 1977) with no holdings accounted for in the Ford Foundation archive. However, the Ford Foundation archive does contain holdings for: Stephen Crane, William Falkner, Donald Finkel, Walter Lippman, Winthrop Sargent, and Thomas Wolfe.

The following authors are represented in the Ford Foundation archive, but do not appear in the published ALM checklist (2nd edition, 1977): Crane Brinton, Henry Commager, Irving Feldman, George Garrett, Rosamond Gilder, Brendan Gill, Wiliam Goyen, john H. Griffin, Oscar Lweis, Russell Lynes, Dwight MacDonald, Paula Marshall, James Boyer Mays, Jean Piaget, Ishmael Reed, James Schevill, Jarvis Thurston, Nicolo Tucci, and Victor Ullman.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Alphabetical by last name of individual.
Material is arranged as received from the Ford Foundation.

did.physdesc: JFK's signature has been cut out from the June 28, 1956 letter to H. Rowan Gaither. The JFK signature went missing before June 1977, as noted in the "Ford Foundation Letter" (newsletter), issued on June 1, 1977.
